Granting Access Rights for Specific Filters and Queries

Within a server configuration, every project offers the same set of public filters and queries. These filters and queries are also available in all project views. Therefore, if users can see a view, they can apply all public filters and queries in that view, as long as no access rights have been set for filters and queries.

Access rights to filters and queries can be set on a per component basis. See Granting Access Rights at the Component Level.

However, access rights can also be specified for an individual filter or query. After access rights have been set for a specific filter or query, only those users specifically granted access to the filter or query can see it and use it. Setting access rights for an individual filter or query requires the server-level right to Administer component-level access rights plus access rights on the particular item.

To set access rights for a filter:

  1. Select the item component tab to which the filter applies.

  2. Do one of the following:

    • Right-click a column header on the upper pane, then select Filters from the context menu.

    • Select Filters > Filters from the component menu or context menu.

    The Filters dialog appears.

  3. Select the filter.

  4. Click Access Rights.... The <filter> Access Rights dialog appears.

  5. From the Access Rights dialog, click Add to add a user or group. The Assign Access Rights To dialog opens.

  6. Select a user or group. Users are listed by their user names and groups are listed by their position in the group hierarchy, except for the All Users group.

  7. Select the Grant option button. Caution: Never select Deny unless you are creating an exception.

  8. Click OK to return to the Access Rights dialog.

  9. Select and/or clear the appropriate check boxes.

  10. Repeat steps 3-9, as required.

  11. Click OK when you are done.

To set access rights for a query:

  1. Select the item component tab to which the filter applies.

  2. Do one of the following:

    • Right-click a column header on upper pane, then select Queries from the context menu.

    • Select Filters > Queries from the component menu or context menu.

    The Queries dialog appears.

  3. Select the query.

  4. Click Access Rights.... The <query> Access Rights dialog appears.

  5. From the Access Rights dialog, click Add to add a user or group. The Assign Access Rights To dialog opens.

  6. Select a user or group. Users are listed by their user names and groups are listed by their paths, except for the All Users group.

  7. Select the Grant option button. Caution: Never select Deny unless you are creating an exception.

  8. Click OK to return to the Access Rights dialog.

  9. Select and/or clear the appropriate check boxes.

  10. Repeat steps 3-9, as required.

  11. Click OK when you are done.

Public Filter Access Rights

See object and its properties

See this filter in the filters list on the toolbar, and view its properties in the Filters dialog.

Modify properties

Change the properties for the filter. The properties that can be modified for a filter are its list of displayed fields, its sorting and grouping rules, the query associated with it, and its context (the items of the component to which it can be applied).

Delete object

Delete the filter from the list of filters.

Change object access rights

Change the access rights for the filter.

Public Query Access Rights

See object and its properties

See this query in the Queries dialog, and view its properties in the Edit Query dialog.

Modify properties

Change the properties for this query. The properties that can be modified are its name and conditions.

Delete object

Delete the query from the list of queries.

Change object access rights

Change the access rights for the query.
